2.2.22  12:48 am   MIGHT QUIT ANALYSIS:
"it's the first day of school"
college?

     "and i think i might quit
cuz the things i've been seeing in here don't make sense"
you've been disillusioned by the system and the curriculum, they're not teaching you what you want to know

     "so i packed up my things and i walked thru the door and i'm
going somewhere else instead"
you're going somewhere else to learn

     "so i chopped down some trees
and i built a small house"
this is about autonomy and independence, and also again the romance of creating things on your own.

     "and i just might be small enough to live in it"
you don't desire much materialistically-- you are small enough to live in this small house without complaining about it

     "then the rain came pouring down
and it made some cool sounds
and i'll tell you what those sounds said"
very good lyrical moment. were these lines inspired by an actual rainy day?

     "(said) hello and goodbye"
hello and goodbye is an odd sort of cool sounding phrase, so that's why it's there.

     "do you feel alright
with the days gone by"
'are you fine? do you have any regrets?'

     "i'll never waste my time"
of course.

"i'll never say goodbye
yes i will but i won't say it tonight"
this is about the ephemerality of life as an artist: i'm never gonna stop creating-- well, i will, but not today.

     "so i picked a new character
and i've just chose my shirt"
videogame-ish imagery.

      also how did you pronounce charactr here
krktr chrhct
krktkrc

     "and i'm going to the land of the 2 letter words
on in up at or so, by if to of no it"
it's a feeling we can't forget"
great

"hello and goodnight
do you feel alriiiight
do you remember the days gone by"
ah, is this like you from the past?

     "do you rem ember the way that we dreamed we could change our lives
do you feel like changing your mind"
do you have any regrets, future me? do you remember our dreams?

     "it's the first day of school
and i think i might quit
cuz the things that i'm feeling still don't make sense"
i can relate to this one too

"and i've tried to explain
and it hurts to describe"
certainly. saying it directly is sort of uncomfortable.
so i'll sing this song instead"
music reaches into a more comfortable place in our souls i suppose

     [instrumental melody]

"hello and goodbye"
great. this is you replying to your past self, in the same way your past self called out to you-- you havent changed in the little ways

     "do you think i'm dying
do you think i'm going somewhere else this time"
i'm fine. i'm fine.

     "do you remember the day we pretended to be every star in the sky"
beautiful. not even going to stain this line with my analysis

     "it's the first day of school
but i think might quit"
coming back home musically, and:

     "gonna learn some new lessons i won't forget"

"gonna write them all down in the language of love"
music

     "and then teach them to everyone"
you want to inspire everyone.

which you have.

1.31.22  10:38 pm   How do you view your accomplishments?

1.31.22  7:05 pm   Bill, I'm worried about never discovering any more music that I love, I mean really love. I'm really heavily into one music artist, I was absolutely in love with them from the start, every song of theirs is gold, but I've just never had that with any other artist. I've listened to the Beatles, Queen, Elton John, etc, the legends, y'know? And while their stuff is good, it's not "incredible", like my first artist. Do I have expectations that are too high to compete with, or am I just lucky to have one artist I love so much, and give up on that ever happening again? I don't know why it gets me so worked up, but I figured it was worth asking you. Have a great day man, thanks
